title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 256.3 - Movement of seized foods
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 256.3 - Movement of seized foods

State Regulations
(a) It
shall be unlawful for foods and devices held under seizure or embargo by the
commissioner to be moved to a different location without prior permission
granted by the commissioner. (b) All movements of seized or embargoed foods are to be made only under the
supervision of the commissioner. (c) Food and food products shall be moved
from the site of a fire, flood, wreck or other cause as expeditiously as
possible so as not to become putrid, unwholesome, rodent or insect harborages, or otherwise a menace to public health. (d) All seized or quarantined foods, prior to
reconditioning and release from seizure, shall be transported only in vehicles
provided with devices to render them capable of being locked and sealed. Where
highly perishable foods are transported, this is to be done in vehicles
provided with adequate refrigeration for product maintenance. Notes

256.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
